item.title: Dollar Likely to Remain Strong Due to US Rate Prospects
item.description: The dollar edged lower, but it remained poised to rise further on prospects of U.S. interest rates staying high, ING said.

item.title: Pepco Updates Profit Forecast After Sales Hit
item.description: Pepco forecast adjusted underlying earnings for the year of €750 million, after it said revenue in core markets in August was lower than expected and worsened this month on weaker consumer demand.

item.title: WTI Moves to 13-Month High Amid Supply Concerns for Crude Oil
item.description: Crude prices continued to rise as concerns over supply added support for key benchmarks.

item.title: No Evidence of a Wage-Price Spiral in Australia, RBA Board Member Says
item.description: There’s no evidence in Australia of a developing wage-price spiral and long-term inflation expectations remain well-anchored, said Ian Harper, a member of the central bank’s interest-rate setting board.

item.title: London Stocks Opens Little Changed; Trade Stays Cautious But Oil Stocks Rise
item.description: The FTSE 100 index opened little changed with gains for heavyweight oil stocks helping to offset falls elsewhere on concerns about rising bond yields and troubles in China’s property market.

item.title: Gold Likely to Extend Weakness, Charts Show
item.description: Gold’s break this week below August’s low of $1,884/oz has been accompanied by robust downward momentum, indicating that the precious metal will continue to weaken, UOB said.

item.title: Diageo Backs Outlook Despite Economic Uncertainty
item.description: Diageo kept its guidance unchanged for fiscal 2024 despite warning of persistent cost pressures and macroeconomic challenges, and said it was well positioned to deliver its 2023-25 sales and profit growth targets.

item.title: China Evergrande Shares Suspended After Reports of Founder's Disappearance
item.description: Trading in the shares of China Evergrande and two of its publicly listed units was suspended following reports that the property developer’s chairman had been placed under police surveillance.

item.title: GOP Presidential Candidates Fail to Outshine Trump at Second Debate
item.description: The event was full of arguments, one-liners and strained attempts for attention, but none of the seven presidential hopefuls articulated a clear case why they should be the front-runner instead of Donald Trump.

item.title: Citi Planning to Sell China Retail-Wealth Unit to HSBC
item.description: Citigroup is in talks to sell its retail-wealth business in China to British rival HSBC, according to a person familiar with the matter.

item.title: Giving Donald Trump a Pass at the GOP Debate
item.description: The other Republican presidential candidates largely left the front-runner off the hook.

item.title: Trump Skips Second GOP Debate, Holds Michigan Rally
item.description: Former President Donald Trump skipped the second Republican presidential debate on Wednesday and held a rally at a car parts manufacturer in Michigan. His visit came a day after President Biden joined striking auto workers on a picket line in the state.

item.title: Watch: Trump Skips Debate, Holds Michigan Rally
Saudi Arabia and Russia Win Big in Gamble on Oil Cuts
item.description: Brent crude is climbing toward $100 a barrel after the two OPEC+ nations made a risky choice to slice their production.

item.title: How the Technological Revolution in Ukraine Is Reshaping Modern Warfare
item.description: New systems are eliminating surprises and making it harder to gain ground in armored assaults.

item.title: India's Spy Agency Adopted New Playbook Before Accusation in Canada Killing
item.description: The foreign intelligence arm at the center of the Canadian government’s allegations has been expanding its covert operations in the West.

item.title: Billions of Dollars in Loans to Board Members Draw Spotlight to Gulf Banks
item.description: The practice, widely discouraged in the U.S., comes as the U.A.E. extends its financial reach.

item.title: Las Vegas Strip workers voted to authorize a possible strike as union contract negotiations continue with casino companies.
item.description: Las Vegas Strip workers voted to authorize a possible strike as union contract negotiations continue with casino companies.

item.title: The UAW pledged to widen its strike this coming Friday barring significant progress in talks with Detroit carmakers, as the companies take steps to keep critical parts flowing to their dealerships.
item.description: The UAW pledged to widen its strike this coming Friday barring significant progress in talks with Detroit carmakers, as the companies take steps to keep critical parts flowing to their dealerships.

item.title: The S&P 500 eked out a negligible gain in a session that saw the Nasdaq add 0.2% and the Dow industrials decline by 0.2%.
item.description: The S&P 500 eked out a negligible gain in a session that saw the Nasdaq add 0.2% and the Dow industrials decline by 0.2%.
